descript.abstract: Layer identifies the location of marinas throughout Grenada along with their carrying capacity (slip and berths). Attempts were made to collect data from all marinas operating in Grenada, however three of the marina operaters did not provided capacity data.
descript.purpose: Resource developed to locate and document the capacity of marinas. This information will help inform The Nature Conservancy’s AWE project. Scientists around the world agree that climate change is indisputable. Impacts, including rising sea levels, increased storm intensity, warming temperatures and acidifying waters, dying coral reefs, shifting fish stocks, and incidence of flooding and drought, are already being felt, and are expected to continue and increase for decades to come. Nature holds some of the world’s best and most practical solutions to climate change, solutions that keep nature and people healthy, safe, and secure. The goal of At the Water’s Edge (AWE) is to demonstrate that governments and people in vulnerable coastal communities in Grenada and St. Vincent and the Grenadines (SVG) can enhance their resilience to climate change by protecting, restoring and effectively managing their marine and coastal ecosystems (also known as ecosystem-based adaptation or EBA) and strengthening local capacity for adaptation.
